Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides "Hibernate" from appearing in the power button in the start menu.

Setting.Name: HideLock
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides "Lock" from appearing in the user tile in the start menu.

Setting.Name: HidePeopleBar
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy removes the people icon from the taskbar as well as the corresponding settings toggle. It also prevents users from pinning people to the taskbar.

Setting.Name: HidePowerButton
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides the power button from appearing in the start menu.

Setting.Name: HideRecentJumplists
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides recent jumplists from appearing on the start menu/taskbar and disables the corresponding toggle in the Settings app.

Setting.Name: HideRecentlyAddedApps
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides recently added apps from appearing on the start menu and disables the corresponding toggle in the Settings app.

Setting.Name: HideRestart
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides "Restart/Update and restart" from appearing in the power button in the start menu.

Setting.Name: HideShutDown
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides "Shut down/Update and shut down" from appearing in the power button in the start menu.

Setting.Name: HideSignOut
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides "Sign out" from appearing in the user tile in the start menu.

Setting.Name: HideSleep
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides "Sleep" from appearing in the power button in the start menu.

Setting.Name: HideSwitchAccount
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides "Switch account" from appearing in the user tile in the start menu.

Setting.Name: HideUserTile
Setting.Description: Enabling this policy hides the user tile from appearing in the start menu.

Setting.Name: ImportEdgeAssets
Setting.Description: This policy setting allows you to import Edge assets to be used with StartLayout policy. Start layout can contain secondary tile from Edge app which looks for Edge local asset file. Edge local asset would not exist and cause Edge secondary tile to appear empty in this case. This policy only gets applied when StartLayout policy is modified.

Setting.Name: NoPinningToTaskbar
Setting.Description: This policy setting allows you to control pinning programs to the Taskbar. If you enable this policy setting, users cannot change the programs currently pinned to the Taskbar. If any programs are already pinned to the Taskbar, these programs continue to show in the Taskbar. However, users cannot unpin these programs already pinned to the Taskbar, and they cannot pin new programs to the Taskbar. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, users can change the programs currently pinned to the Taskbar.

Setting.Name: StartLayout
Setting.Description: This policy applies a layout to Start (typically the output of Export-StartLayout in PowerShell). When a full Start layout is applied with this method, the users cannot pin, unpin, or uninstall apps from Start. Users can view and open all apps in the All Apps view, but they cannot pin any apps to Start. When a partial Start layout is applied, the contents of the specified tile groups cannot be changed, but users can move those groups, and can also create and customize their own groups.

Setting.Name: AllowKeyboardTextSuggestions
Setting.Description: When set to no, disables text prediction for consumers using msTextPrediction DLL

Setting.Name: ConfigureTimeZone
Setting.Description: Specifies the time zone to be applied to the device. This is the standard Windows name for the target time zone.

Setting.Name: AllowAutomaticRestartSignOn
Setting.Description: This policy setting controls whether a device will automatically sign-in the last interactive user after Windows Update restarts the system. If you enable or do not configure this policy setting, the device securely saves the user's credentials (including the user name, domain and encrypted password) to configure automatic sign-in after a Windows Update restart. After the Windows Update restart, the user is automatically signed-in and the session is automatically locked with all the lock screen apps configured for that user. If you disable this policy setting, the device does not store the user's credentials for automatic sign-in after a Windows Update restart. The users' lock screen apps are not restarted after the system restarts.

Setting.Name: DisableLockScreenAppNotifications
Setting.Description: This policy setting allows you to prevent app notifications from appearing on the lock screen. If you enable this policy setting, no app notifications are displayed on the lock screen. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, users can choose which apps display notifications on the lock screen.

Setting.Name: EnableFirstLogonAnimation
Setting.Description: This policy setting allows you to control whether users see the first sign-in animation when signing in to the computer for the first time. This applies to both the first user of the computer who completes the initial setup and users who are added to the computer later. It also controls if Microsoft account users will be offered the opt-in prompt for services during their first sign-in. If you enable this policy setting, Microsoft account users will see the opt-in prompt for services, and users with other accounts will see the sign-in animation. If you disable this policy setting, users will not see the animation and Microsoft account users will not see the opt-in prompt for services. If you do not configure this policy setting, the user who completes the initial Windows setup will see the animation during their first sign-in. If the first user had already completed the initial setup and this policy setting is not configured, users new to this computer will not see the animation. Note: The first sign-in animation will not be shown on Server, so this policy will have no effect.

Setting.Name: HideFastUserSwitching
Setting.Description: This policy setting allows you to hide the Switch User interface in the Logon UI, the Start menu and the Task Manager. If you enable this policy setting, the Switch User interface is hidden from the user who is attempting to log on or is logged on to the computer that has this policy applied. The locations that Switch User interface appear are in the Logon UI, the Start menu and the Task Manager. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the Switch User interface is accessible to the user in the three locations.

Setting.Name: AllowSystemRequiredPowerRequests
Setting.Description: Specifies whether System Required power requests are allowed on systems capable of connected standby.

Setting.Name: DefaultOverlayAcPowerScheme
Setting.Description: Specifies the default overlay power scheme to use on AC.

Setting.Name: DefaultOverlayDcPowerScheme
Setting.Description: Specifies the default overlay power scheme to use on DC.

Setting.Name: DefaultOverlayPowerScheme
Setting.Description: Specifies the default overlay power scheme to use. This setting is deprecated.

Setting.Name: DimTimeoutIsManuallySpecified
Setting.Description: Set to True to control the period before the screen dims using the DimTimeout setting, False to allow Windows to automatically select the period based on the screen off timeout

Setting.Name: DisableBatteryDischargeEstimator
Setting.Description: Configures battery discharge time estimaton.

Setting.Name: EnableInputSuppression
Setting.Description: Specifies whether to suppress input for modern standby systems when the lid is closed.

Setting.Name: EnforceConsoleLockScreenTimeout
Setting.Description: Specifies whether the console lock screen timeout should be enforced independently of the user display timeout

Setting.Name: EnforceDisconnectedStandby
Setting.Description: Specifies whether to force the network to disconnect during standby

Setting.Name: HiberFileType
Setting.Description: Specifies the type of HiberFile to be used by the system. Set to 'Reduced' to allow Fast Startup but not Hibernate. Set to 'Full' to allow both Fast Startup and Hibernate.

Setting.Name: IgnoreCsComplianceCheck
Setting.Description: Specifies whether to ignore Connected-Standby compliance checks

Setting.Name: LidNotificationsAreReliable
Setting.Description: Set to True if the platform guarantees that lid notifications will be sent every time the lid is opened or closed. False otherwise

Setting.Name: SmartUserPresenceConfidence
Setting.Description: Specifies the confidence (in percentage) in predicted user-away interval(s)

Setting.Name: CPU
Setting.Description: Specify the parameters needed for CPU power model.

Setting.Name: Display
Setting.Description: Specify the parameters needed for display power model.

Setting.Name: DisplayBacklightPowerFloor
Setting.Description: Specifies display backlight power floor in milli-watts.

Setting.Name: DisplayBacklightPowerGradient
Setting.Description: Specifies display backlight power gradient with respect to brightness.

Setting.Name: DisplayBacklightPowerQDenominator
Setting.Description: Specifies display backlight power's denominator part of the gradient with respect to brightness squared.

Setting.Name: DisplayBacklightPowerQNumerator
Setting.Description: Specifies display backlight power's numerator part of the gradient with respect to brightness squared.

Setting.Name: DisplayPanelPowerAreaFactor
Setting.Description: Specifies display panel power factor for panel area.

Setting.Name: DisplayPanelPowerDpiFactor
Setting.Description: Specifies display panel power factor for display DPI.

Setting.Name: DisplayPanelPowerFloor
Setting.Description: Specifies display panel power floor in milli-watts.

Setting.Name: DisplayPanelPowerVsyncDelta
Setting.Description: Specifies additional display panel power in milli-watts when vsync is on.

Setting.Name: MobileBroadband
Setting.Description: Specify the parameters needed for mobile broadband power model.

Setting.Name: StandbyActivationEnergy
Setting.Description: Specify the parameters needed for standby activation energy model.

Setting.Name: Storage
Setting.Description: Specify the parameters needed for storage power model.

Setting.Name: Wifi
Setting.Description: Specify the parameters needed for wifi power model.

Setting.Name: HeteroDecreaseThreshold
Setting.Description: Processor decrease threshold for individual class1 processors

Setting.Name: HeteroIncreaseThreshold
Setting.Description: Processor increase threshold for individual class1 processors

Setting.Name: StorageD3InModernStandby
Setting.Description: StorageD3InModernStandby allows an OEM to enable Storage Device D3 in Modern Standby platform.

Setting.Name: ConvertibleSlateModePromptPreference
Setting.Description: Sets the default for hardware-based prompts

Setting.Name: SignInMode
Setting.Description: Specifies whether users switch to tablet mode by default after signing in

Setting.Name: UniversalAppInstall
Setting.Description: Install Universal Applications from the Store or Hosted location

Setting.Name: UniversalAppUninstall
Setting.Description: Uninstall Universal Applications

Setting.Name: UsbErrorsOEMOverride
Setting.Description: UsbErrorOEMOverride Allows a OEM to Hide All USB Device Errors

Setting.Name: WeakCharger
Setting.Description: Enable Weak Charger Notification by Default

Setting.Name: WindowsHelloForBusiness
Setting.Description: Configure a PC for Windows Hello for Business.

Setting.Name: Biometrics
Setting.Description: Configure biometrics usage for Windows Hello.

Setting.Name: FacialFeaturesUseEnhancedAntiSpoofing
Setting.Description: This setting determines whether enhanced anti-spoofing is required for Windows Hello face authentication. If you enable this setting, Windows requires all users on managed devices to use enhanced anti-spoofing for Windows Hello face authentication. This disables Windows Hello face authentication on devices that do not support enhanced anti-spoofing. If you disable or do not configure this setting, Windows doesn't require enhanced anti-spoofing for Windows Hello face authentication. Note that enhanced anti-spoofing for Windows Hello face authentication is not required on unmanaged devices.

Setting.Name: UseBiometrics
Setting.Description: Windows Hello for Business enables users to use biometric gestures, such as face and fingerprints, as an alternative to the PIN gesture. However, users must still configure a PIN to use in case of failures. If you enable or do not configure this policy setting, Windows Hello for Business allows the use of biometric gestures. If you disable this policy setting, Windows Hello for Business prevents the use of biometric gestures. NOTE: Disabling this policy prevents the use of biometric gestures on the device for all account types.

Setting.Name: PoliciesForAllTenants
Setting.Description: Configure Policies on any tenant ID for Windows Hello.

Setting.Name: UsePassportForWork
Setting.Description: Windows Hello for Business is an alternative method for signing into Windows using your Active Directory or Azure Active Directory account that can replace passwords, Smart Cards, and Virtual Smart Cards. If you enable or do not configure this policy setting, the device provisions Windows Hello for Business for all users. If you disable this policy setting, the device does not provision Windows Hello for Business for any user.

Setting.Name: SecurityKeys
Setting.Description: Configure Security Keys for Windows Hello.

Setting.Name: UseSecurityKeyForSignin
Setting.Description: Use Security Keys for Windows Hello at logon

Setting.Name: AreaName
Setting.Description: Enter the area name of the policy that needs to be set. For more details refer MSDN documentation on ADMX Ingested MDM policies.

Setting.Name: AppName
Setting.Description: Enter name of the Win32 App.

Setting.Name: AssignedAccess
Setting.Description: Configure Assigned Access

Setting.Name: AssignedAccessSettings
Setting.Description: Set account and app (by AUMID). Example: {"Account":"domain\\user", "AUMID":"Microsoft.WindowsCalculator_8wekyb3d8bbwe!App"}.

Setting.Name: MultiAppAssignedAccessSettings
Setting.Description: Deploy Multi App Assigned Access configuration xml file to the device

Setting.Name: CellularFailover
Setting.Description: Allow or disallow cellular data failover when in limited Wi-Fi connectivity

Setting.Name: EmbeddedUiccSlotId
Setting.Description: Embedded UICC (eUICC) slot ID

Setting.Name: SlotSelectionSim1Name
Setting.Description: Name of SIM 1 in slot selection UI

Setting.Name: SlotSelectionSim2Name
Setting.Description: Name of SIM 2 in slot selection UI

Setting.Name: AllowedAppIdList
Setting.Description: List of application IDs that are allowed access

Setting.Name: AckExpirySeconds
Setting.Description: Set how long we wait for a client ACK before trying to delivery

Setting.Name: DefaultMCC
Setting.Description: Set the default mobile country code (MCC)

Setting.Name: GSM7BitEncodingPage
Setting.Description: Set the 7 bit GSM default alphabet encoding

Setting.Name: GSM8BitEncodingPage
Setting.Description: Set an 8 bit GSM encoding (OEM set)

Setting.Name: OctetEncodingPage
Setting.Description: Set the octet (binary) encoding

Setting.Name: SendUDHNLSS
Setting.Description: Set the 7 bit GSM shift table encoding

Setting.Name: UseASCII
Setting.Description: Set the 7 bit ASCII encoding

Setting.Name: UseKeyboardLanguage
Setting.Description: Set if we use keyboard language (Portuguese/Spanish/Turkish) based encoding (set shift table based on keyboard language)

Setting.Name: IncompleteMsgDeliverySeconds
Setting.Description: How long we wait for all parts of multisegement Sprint messages for concatenation

Setting.Name: MessageExpirySeconds
Setting.Description: Set how long we store undelivered messages (e.g. holding parts of a multisegment message waiting for undelivered part(s))

Setting.Name: SmsFragmentLimit
Setting.Description: Set the number of octets (byte) in a single fragment (segment)

Setting.Name: SmsPageLimit
Setting.Description: Set the number of total pages (segments) possible for a message

Setting.Name: SmsStoreDeleteSize
Setting.Description: Set the number messages that can be deleted when message full indication is received from modem

Setting.Name: SprintFragmentInfoInBody
Setting.Description: Use Sprint's specific segmentation method

Setting.Name: AttemptThresholdForIMS
Setting.Description: Set the maximum number of tries to send SMS on IMS. After maximum number of attempts are reached the retry will only be on 1xRTT/GSM.

Setting.Name: RetryEnabled
Setting.Description: Set to enable one automatic retry on 1xRTT/GSM for sending a SMS message after failure to send over IMS.

Setting.Name: SmsUse16BitReferenceNumbers
Setting.Description: Set if we use an 8 bit or 16 bit message ID (reference number) in the UDH

Setting.Name: UseReservedAsPermanent
Setting.Description: Set the 3GPP2 permanent error type

Setting.Name: SignalBarMappingTable
Setting.Description: Customize the global mapping between the cellular connection signal strength and the number of bars shown.

Setting.Name: CleanPCRetainingUserData
Setting.Description: Use to remove pre-installed software and keep user data.

Setting.Name: CleanPCWithoutRetainingUserData
Setting.Description: Use to remove pre-installed software without keeping any user data.

Setting.Name: DeployDesktopBackgroundFile
Setting.Description: Deploy Desktop Background file to the device

Setting.Name: DeviceUpdateCenter
Setting.Description: Configure device with DUC attributes obtained during Registration through DUC Portal

Setting.Name: CustomPackageId
Setting.Description: Package ID for custom content published by OEM.

Setting.Name: DeviceModelId
Setting.Description: Identifies a specific category of OEM device. OEMs can categorize their devices and specify them in the DUC portal.

Setting.Name: OemPartnerRing
Setting.Description: OEMs can choose between 3 (deployment) rings for their device - Preview, EarlyAdopter, GeneralAvailability.

Setting.Name: PublisherId
Setting.Description: Unique ID (string) per OEM that is generated during the registration process in DUC portal.

Setting.Name: AllowWindowsEntitlementReactivation
Setting.Description: This policy setting controls whether OS Reactivation is blocked on a device

Setting.Name: DisallowKMSClientOnlineAVSValidation
Setting.Description: This policy setting controls whether AVS validation is blocked on a device

Setting.Name: EnableCortanaVoice
Setting.Description: Enables Cortana voiceover in OOBE for Pro and above SKUs.

Setting.Name: HideOobe
Setting.Description: When set to TRUE hides the interactive OOBE flow for desktop.

Setting.Name: Personalization
Setting.Description: Configure a PC's personalization settings such as Desktop Image and Lock Screen Image.

Setting.Name: DeployDesktopImage
Setting.Description: Deploy a jpg, jpeg or png image to the device to be used as desktop image.

Setting.Name: DeployLockScreenImage
Setting.Description: Deploy a jpg, jpeg or png image to the device to be used as lock screen image.

Setting.Name: DesktopImageUrl
Setting.Description: Specify a jpg, jpeg or png image to be used as Desktop Image. This setting can take a http or https Url to a remote image to be downloaded or a file Url to an existing local image. This setting can also use the image as supplied in the DeployDesktopImage asset node. In this case, DesktopImageUrl should be given just the file name in the DeployDesktopImage value.

Setting.Name: LockScreenImageUrl
Setting.Description: Specify a jpg, jpeg or png image to be used as Lock Screen Image. This setting can take a http or https Url to a remote image to be downloaded or a file Url to an existing local image. This setting can also use the image as supplied in the DeployLockScreenImage asset node. In this case, LockScreenImageUrl should be given just the file name in the DeployLockScreenImage value.

Setting.Name: ProvisioningCommands
Setting.Description: Run scripts and commands during provisioning to allow custom setup and installation of win32 applications.

Setting.Name: DeviceContext
Setting.Description: Commands and scripts to run in a device context.

Setting.Name: PrimaryContext
Setting.Description: Commands and scripts to run in a device context.

Setting.Name: SharedPC
Setting.Description: Configure a PC for shared use scenarios.

Setting.Name: AccountManagement
Setting.Description: Set options for shared PC account management.

Setting.Name: AccountModel
Setting.Description: Configures which type of accounts are allowed to use the PC.

Setting.Name: DeletionPolicy
Setting.Description: Configures when accounts will be deleted.

Setting.Name: DiskLevelCaching
Setting.Description: Stop deleting accounts when available disk space reaches this threshold, given as percent of total disk capacity.

Setting.Name: DiskLevelDeletion
Setting.Description: Accounts will start being deleted when available disk space falls below this threshold, given as percent of total disk capacity. Accounts that have been inactive the longest will be deleted first.

Setting.Name: EnableAccountManager
Setting.Description: Enable the account manager for shared PC mode.

Setting.Name: InactiveThreshold
Setting.Description: Accounts will start being deleted when they have not been logged on during the specified period, given as number of days.

Setting.Name: KioskModeAUMID
Setting.Description: Specifies the AUMID of the app to use with assigned access.

Setting.Name: KioskModeUserTileDisplayText
Setting.Description: Specifies the display text for the account shown on the sign-in screen which launches the app specified by KioskModeAUMID.

Setting.Name: EnableSharedPCMode
Setting.Description: Enable shared PC mode and apply policies.

Setting.Name: PolicyCustomization
Setting.Description: Shared PC mode policy customization.

Setting.Name: MaintenanceStartTime
Setting.Description: Daily start time of maintenance hour, given in minutes from midnight.

Setting.Name: MaxPageFileSizeMB
Setting.Description: Maximum size of the paging file in MB. Applies only to systems with less than 32 GB storage and at least 3 GB of RAM.

Setting.Name: RestrictLocalStorage
Setting.Description: Restrict using local storage when configuring shared PC mode.

Setting.Name: SetEduPolicies
Setting.Description: Set education-appropriate policies.

Setting.Name: SetPowerPolicies
Setting.Description: Set power policies when configuring shared PC mode.

Setting.Name: SignInOnResume
Setting.Description: Require users to sign in when the device resumes from sleep.

Setting.Name: SleepTimeout
Setting.Description: The amount of idle time before the PC sleeps, given in seconds. 0 means the PC never sleeps.

Setting.Name: SMISettings
Setting.Description: Configure device with custom shell and suppress Windows UI during boot and logon

Setting.Name: AutoLogon
Setting.Description: sign in automatically at startup without the user needing to enter a user name and password.

Setting.Name: DomainName
Setting.Description: Domain name of the auto logon user.

Setting.Name: Enable
Setting.Description: Enable Auto Logon

Setting.Name: Password
Setting.Description: Password of the auto logon user.

Setting.Name: UserName
Setting.Description: Default user name that will be automatically signed into.

Setting.Name: BrandingNeutral
Setting.Description: Bit-based setting for disabling UI anchors on logon screen.

Setting.Name: CrashDumpEnabled
Setting.Description: Specify the type of information to be saved in the event of a crash.

Setting.Name: DisableBootMenu
Setting.Description: Disables boot menus (F8/F10/OS Selection).

Setting.Name: DisplayDisabled
Setting.Description: Disable the crash screen.

Setting.Name: HideAllBootUI
Setting.Description: Boolean setting for hiding all of the boot UI elements.

Setting.Name: HideAutologonUI
Setting.Description: Boolean setting for disabling AutoLogon UI.

Setting.Name: HideBootLogo
Setting.Description: Disable the boot logo.

Setting.Name: HideBootStatusIndicator
Setting.Description: Hide the boot status indicator.

Setting.Name: HideBootStatusMessage
Setting.Description: Hide boot status message.

Setting.Name: HideFirstLogonAnimation
Setting.Description: Boolean setting for disabling First Logon Animation.

Setting.Name: KeyboardFilter
Setting.Description: Configure device to suppress undesireable key presses or key combinations

Setting.Name: DisableKeyboardFilterForAdministrators
Setting.Description: Disable Keyboard Filtering of Administrator Users

Setting.Name: Enable
Setting.Description: Enable Keyboard Filter

Setting.Name: ForceOffAccessibility
Setting.Description: Force off all accessibility features that interfere with the Keyboard Filter.

Setting.Name: Alt
Setting.Description: If nothing is specified, the value will default to Allow. Specifying Block will suppress the key combination

Setting.Name: AltF4
Setting.Description: If nothing is specified, the value will default to Allow. Specifying Block will suppress the key combination

Setting.Name: NoLockScreen
Setting.Description: Boolean setting for disabling lock screen.

Setting.Name: ShellLauncher
Setting.Description: Replaces explorer.exe with a custom shell application

Setting.Name: DefaultCustomShell
Setting.Description: Default custom shell launched by Shell Launcher. The shell will default to cmd.exe if not specified.

Setting.Name: DefaultReturnCodeAction
Setting.Description: Action for custom shell return code that is not specified for the logon user.

Setting.Name: Enable
Setting.Description: Enable Shell Launcher

Setting.Name: UserSpecificSettings
Setting.Description: Holds Custom Shell Settings for Local/Domain users and user SID

Setting.Name: DomainUserSpecificSettings
Setting.Description: Specific settings per each domain user

Setting.Name: LocalUserSpecificSettings
Setting.Description: Specific settings per each local user

Setting.Name: UserSIDSpecificSettings
Setting.Description: Specific settings per each user

Setting.Name: UIVerbosityLevel
Setting.Description: Integer setting for Windows logon status display.

Setting.Name: StartLayout
Setting.Description: Deploy Start Layout LayoutModification.xml file to the device (Ensure file name is LayoutModification.xml)

Setting.Name: TakeATest
Setting.Description: Configure 'Take a Test'

Setting.Name: AllowScreenMonitoring
Setting.Description: Indicates if screen monitoring is allowed by the app.

Setting.Name: AllowTextSuggestions
Setting.Description: Indicates if keyboard text suggestions are allowed by the app.

Setting.Name: LaunchURI
Setting.Description: Specify a link to an assessment that will be automatically loaded when the 'Take a Test' app is launched.

Setting.Name: RequirePrinting
Setting.Description: Indicates if printing is required by the app.

Setting.Name: TesterAccount
Setting.Description: Specify the dedicated account to use when taking a test.

Setting.Name: ProvisionSetTimeZone
Setting.Description: When set to TRUE skips time zone assignment during first user logon

Setting.Name: UnifiedWriteFilter
Setting.Description: Unified Write Filter Provisioning Settings

Setting.Name: FilterEnabled
Setting.Description: Enable/Disable Unified Write filter

Setting.Name: OverlayFlags
Setting.Description: Change UWF Overlay Flags

Setting.Name: OverlaySize
Setting.Description: Change Maximum Overlay Size(MB)

Setting.Name: OverlayType
Setting.Description: Change UWF Overlay Type

Setting.Name: Add
Setting.Description: List of registries being excluded from protection

Setting.Name: Remove
Setting.Description: List of registries being removed from registry exclusion

Setting.Name: ResetPersistentState
Setting.Description: Reset UWF Overlay Persistent State

Setting.Name: Volumes
Setting.Description: List of historically protected volumes
